TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Table extends System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl implements class System.Web.UI.IPostBackEventHandler

Docs.summary: Displays a table on a Web page.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In this topic: - [Introduction](#introduction) - [Accessibility](#accessibility) - [Declarative Syntax](#declarative_syntax) ## Introduction The Table control allows you to build an HTML table and specify its characteristics in a straightforward manner. A table can be built at design time given some static content, but the power of a Table Web server control is often realized when the table is built programmatically with dynamic contents. > [!NOTE] > If the `controlRenderingCompatibilityVersion` attribute of the element in the Web.config file is set to `3.5`, the control renders a `border` attribute that is set to "0" on the HTML `table` element. It is important to remember that any programmatic addition or modification of table rows or cells will not persist across posts to the server. This is because table rows and cells are controls of their own, and not properties of the Table control. To persist any changes to the table, rows and cells must be reconstructed after each postback. In fact, if substantial modifications are expected, it is recommended that a , , or control be used instead of the Table control. As a result, the Table class is primarily used by control developers. > [!CAUTION] > This control can be used to display user input, which might include malicious client script. Check any information that is sent from a client for executable script, SQL statements, or other code before displaying it in your application. You can use validation controls to verify user input before displaying the input text in a control. ASP.NET provides an input request validation feature to block script and HTML in user input. For more information, see [Securing Standard Controls](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md), [How to: Protect Against Script Exploits in a Web Application by Applying HTML Encoding to Strings](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md), and [Validating User Input in ASP.NET Web Pages](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md). ## Accessibility For information about how to configure this control so that it generates markup that conforms to accessibility standards, see [Accessibility in Visual Studio and ASP.NET](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) and [ASP.NET Controls and Accessibility](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md). ## Declarative Syntax ```                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     ``` ## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a table at design time. The table contains two rows of two cells each. > [!NOTE] > The following code sample uses the single-file code model and may not work correctly if copied directly into a code-behind file. This code sample must be copied into an empty text file that has an .aspx extension. For more information on the Web Forms code model, see [ASP.NET Web Forms Page Code Model](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md). [!code-cs[Classic Table Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_64_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[Classic Table Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_64_1.aspx)] The following code example demonstrates how to construct a table programmatically. Creating a table dynamically consists of three steps. First, create objects to represent the cells in a row. Content for the cells is added by either setting the property or by adding controls to the collection of the . Next, create a to represent a row in the table. Add the objects created earlier to the collection of the . Finally, add the to the collection of the Table control. Repeat this process for each row in the table. [!code-vb[Classic Table Example#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_64_2.aspx)] [!code-cs[Classic Table Example#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_64_2.aspx)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void AddAttributesToRender(class System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter writer) cil managed

Docs.param: The output stream that renders HTML content to the client.
Docs.summary: Adds HTML attributes and styles that need to be rendered to the specified .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is used primarily by control developers to insert the appropriate attributes and styles into the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> output stream for a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> control. This method overrides <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.AddAttributesToRender%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to override the AddAttributesToRender method in a custom server control to add an attribute to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table>.
[!code-vb[CustomTableAddAttributesToRender#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/0b00d4f4-ed3f-4c37-b3dc-_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[CustomTableAddAttributesToRender#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/0b00d4f4-ed3f-4c37-b3dc-_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[CustomTableAddAttributesToRender#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/0b00d4f4-ed3f-4c37-b3dc-_2.cs)] [!code-vb[CustomTableAddAttributesToRender#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/0b00d4f4-ed3f-4c37-b3dc-_2.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string BackImageUrl { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the URL of the background image to display behind the control.
Docs.value: The URL of the background image for the control. The default value is <xref:System.String.Empty?displayProperty=fullName>.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the BackImageUrl property to specify the location of an image to display in the background of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> control. You can use a relative or an absolute URL. A relative URL relates the location of the image to the location of the Web page or user control without specifying a complete path on the server. The path is relative to the location of the Web page. This makes it easier to move the entire site to another directory on the server without updating the path to the image in code. An absolute URL provides the complete path, so moving the site to another directory requires updating the code.
> [!NOTE] > If the image is smaller than the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> control, it will be tiled.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string Caption { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the text to render in an HTML caption element in a control. This property is provided to make the control more accessible to users of Assistive Technology devices.
Docs.value: A string that represents the text to render in an HTML caption element in a control. The default value is an empty string ("").

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the Caption property to specify the text to render in an HTML caption element in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> control. The text that you specify provides Assistive Technology devices with a description of the table that can be used to make the control more accessible.
Additional accessibility support for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> control is provided by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table.CaptionAlign%2A> property. Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table.CaptionAlign%2A> property to specify the alignment of the HTML caption element in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> control.
The value of this property, when set, can be saved automatically to a resource file by using a designer tool. For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.LocalizableAttribute> and [Globalization and Localization](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal or vertical position of the HTML caption element in a control. This property is provided to make the control more accessible to users of Assistive Technology devices.
Docs.value: One of the enumeration values. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the CaptionAlign property to specify the horizontal or vertical position of the HTML caption element in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> control. This property is provided to make the control more accessible to users of Assistive Technology devices.
This property is set using one of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCaptionAlign> enumeration values. The following table lists the possible values.
|Value|Description| |-----------|-----------------| |`NotSet`|The caption element's alignment is not set.| |`Top`|The caption element is aligned with the top of the table.| |`Bottom`|The caption element is aligned with the bottom of the table.| |`Left`|The caption element is aligned with the left of the table.| |`Right`|The caption element is aligned with the right of the table.|
Additional accessibility support for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> control is provided by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table.Caption%2A> property. Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table.Caption%2A> property to specify the text to render in an HTML caption element in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> control.

Docs.exception: The specified type is not one of the enumeration values.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual int CellPadding { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the amount of space between the contents of a cell and the cell's border.
Docs.value: The amount of space, in pixels, between the contents of a cell and the cell's border. The default value is -1, which indicates that the property has not been set.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the CellPadding property to control the spacing between the contents of a cell and the cell's border. The padding amount specified is added to all four sides of the cell.
All cells in the same column of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> control have the same width. The padding amount is applied to the widest cell and all other cells in the column have this cell width.
Similarly, all cells in the same row have the same height. The padding amount is applied to the tallest cell in the row and all other cells in the row have this cell height. Individual cell sizes cannot be specified.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual int CellSpacing { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the amount of space between cells.
Docs.value: The amount of space, in pixels, between cells. The default value is -1, which indicates that the property has not been set.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the CellSpacing property to control the spacing between adjacent cells in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> control. This spacing is applied both vertically and horizontally. The cell spacing is uniform for the entire table. Individual cell spacing between each row or column cannot be specified.
> [!NOTE] > If you set this property to a value greater than 0 and set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table.GridLines%2A> property to a value that displays the cell borders, a gap is displayed between the borders of adjacent cells. In this situation, the CellSpacing property controls the size of the gap.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance class System.Web.UI.ControlCollection CreateControlCollection() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a new object to hold the controls of the current control.
Docs.returns: A object to contain the controls of the current control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is used primarily by control developers when deriving a custom class from a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> control.
This method overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.CreateControlCollection%2A> implementation for the base <xref:System.Web.UI.Control> class. For a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> control, the CreateControlCollection always returns a <xref:System.Web.UI.ControlCollection> that can only contain <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow> controls of the current <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> control.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to override the CreateControlCollection method in a custom server control so that it always returns a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.EmptyControlCollection> class for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table>.
[!code-vb[CustomTableCreateControlCollection#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.ui.webcontr_203_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[CustomTableCreateControlCollection#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.ui.webcontr_203_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[CustomTableCreateControlCollection#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.ui.webcontr_203_2.cs)] [!code-vb[CustomTableCreateControlCollection#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.ui.webcontr_203_2.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a reference to a collection of properties that define the appearance of a control.
Docs.returns: A reference to the object that contains the properties that define the appearance of the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is used primarily by control developers when deriving a custom control from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> class.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to override the CreateControlStyle method in a custom server control so that it always returns an empty <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableStyle> for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table>.
[!code-vb[CustomTableCreateControlStyle#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.ui.webcontr_160_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[CustomTableCreateControlStyle#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.ui.webcontr_160_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[CustomTableCreateControlStyle#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.ui.webcontr_160_2.cs)] [!code-vb[CustomTableCreateControlStyle#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.ui.webcontr_160_2.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridLines GridLines { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the grid line style to display in the control.
Docs.value: One of the enumeration values. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the GridLines property to specify which cell borders are displayed in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> control. The following table lists the different grid line styles.
|GridLine value|Description| |--------------------|-----------------| |`None`|No cell borders are displayed.| |`Horizontal`|Only the horizontal cell borders are displayed.| |`Vertical`|Only the vertical cell borders are displayed.| |`Both`|Both the horizontal and vertical cell borders are displayed.|
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the GridLines property to specify the grid line style.
> [!NOTE] > The following code sample uses the single-file code model and may not work correctly if copied directly into a code-behind file. This code sample must be copied into an empty text file that has an .aspx extension. For more information on the Web Forms code model, see [ASP.NET Web Forms Page Code Model](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
[!code-cs[Classic Table.GridLines Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.ui.webcontr_1132_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[Classic Table.GridLines Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.ui.webcontr_1132_1.aspx)]

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Web.UI.WebControls.HorizontalAlign HorizontalAlign { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal alignment of the control on the page.
Docs.value: One of the enumeration values. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the HorizontalAlign property to specify the horizontal alignment of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> control within the page. The following table lists the different horizontal alignment styles.
|HorizontalAlign value|Description| |---------------------------|-----------------| |`NotSet`|The horizontal alignment of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> control has not been set.| |`Left`|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> control is left justified on the page.| |`Center`|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> control is centered on the page.| |`Right`|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> control is right justified on the page.| |`Justify`|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> control is aligned with both the left and right margins of the page.|
## Examples [!code-cs[CustomTableAlign#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.ui.webcontr_320_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[CustomTableAlign#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.ui.webcontr_320_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[XpsCreate#XpsCreateAddPkgContent](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/XpsCreate/XpsCreate.cs#xpscreateaddpkgcontent)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void RaisePostBackEvent(string argument) cil managed

Docs.param: A <xref:System.String> that represents the argument for the event.
Docs.summary: Raises events for the control when a form is posted back to the server.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The page passes the value of the `argument` parameter to the RaisePostBackEvent method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void RenderBeginTag(class System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter writer) cil managed

Docs.param: An that represents the output stream to render HTML content on the client.
Docs.summary: Renders the HTML opening tag of the control to the specified writer.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is used primarily by control developers when deriving a custom class from a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> control.
The RenderBeginTag method renders the opening tag for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> control, and renders tags for the table caption and alignment, if necessary.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyorassemblyhidebysig virtual instance void RenderContents(class System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter writer) cil managed

Docs.param: An that represents the output stream to render HTML content on the client.
Docs.summary: Renders the rows in the table control to the specified writer.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is used primarily by control developers when deriving a custom class from a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> control implements the RenderContents to render the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table.Rows%2A> of the table.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to override the RenderContents method in a custom server control so that it always inserts a header row for a custom <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> server control.
[!code-vb[CustomTableRenderContents#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.ui.webcontr_172_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[CustomTableRenderContents#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.ui.webcontr_172_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[CustomTableRenderContents#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.ui.webcontr_172_2.cs)] [!code-vb[CustomTableRenderContents#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.ui.webcontr_172_2.vb)]

Docs.exception: The table sections are not in order.

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of rows in the control.
Docs.value: A that contains the objects in the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the Rows collection to programmatically manage the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow> objects in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> control. A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow> represents a row in the table.
> [!NOTE] > This property is normally used only when building tables programmatically. At design time, it is set by declaring <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow> objects between the opening and closing tags of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> control.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how use the Rows collection to construct a table programmatically. Creating a table dynamically consists of three steps. First, create <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell> objects to represent the cells in a row. Content for the cells is added by either setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.Text%2A> property or by adding controls to the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Controls%2A?displayProperty=fullName> collection of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell>. Next, create a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow> to represent a row in the table. Add the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell> objects created earlier to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow.Cells%2A> collection of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow>. Finally, add the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow> to the Rows collection of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> control. Repeat this process for each row in the table.
> [!NOTE] > The following code sample uses the single-file code model and may not work correctly if copied directly into a code-behind file. This code sample must be copied into an empty text file that has an. aspx extension. For more information on the Web Forms code model, see [ASP.NET Web Forms Page Code Model](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
[!code-vb[Classic Table Example#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.ui.webcontr_457_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[Classic Table Example#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.ui.webcontr_457_1.aspx)]

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the control should set the attribute of the rendered HTML element to "disabled" when the control's <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.IsEnabled%2A> property is .
Docs.value: if the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.RenderingCompatibility%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property indicates an ASP.NET version lower than `4.0`; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property indicates how ASP.NET should render HTML for a control when the control is disabled. If this property is `true`, ASP.NET renders a `disabled` attribute when a control is disabled. If this property is `false`, ASP.NET renders a `class` attribute when a control is disabled. For more information, see <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.SupportsDisabledAttribute%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method hidebysig newslot virtual instance void System.Web.UI.IPostBackEventHandler.RaisePostBackEvent(string eventArgument) cil managed

Docs.summary: For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackEventHandler.RaisePostBackEvent%2A>.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Typically, you should use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table.RaisePostBackEvent%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to raise an event for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> control when a form is posted back to the server.
This method is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackEventHandler> interface.
